shared_text:
School News Network
August 4 at 1:12 PM ¬∑

Books on the Go! Good stuff from Kenowa Hills Public Schools.

Led by Liz Greemann (left) and Brooke Johnston, teachers at Kenowa Hills Alpine Elementary School, Books on the Go aimed to create opportunities this summer for children to see themselves as readers and for families to learn skills and strategies to support literacy at home.

All summer, a mobile reading van (that also included ice cream) visited common locations on a consistent schedule for an interactive read aloud, phonic and vocabulary games (with social distancing expectations communicated in advance) and more.

District high school students and other Kenowa Hills staff members served as volunteers, and every student left with a new book of their choice to bring home.

Kenowa Hills Public Schools Kenowa Hills Alpine Elementary

Knights at KHHS and Pathways had an opportunity to explore the Health Sciences programs at Davenport University (DU). The event titled "Hands On Health" was just that - Knights attended various breakout sessions such as anatomy and physiology, occupational therapy and medical simulation models. In the anatomy and physiology session, students learned from one of DUs professors how the lungs function and interacted with actual pig lungs. In the occupational therapy session, students got to experience what happens to people who have a stroke or brain injury and lose various abilities, having to relearn simple day -to-day activities.

DU has a state of the art medical simulation lab where students were able to listen to healthy versus unhealthy breathing.

Yet another great experience for our students to explore opportunities for their future!
